titleInfo.title: 5-80 Irwin Village Site 11CP5, Campbell Co., TN. Mound 1. Feature 9, Three rows of stone on edge at right angles to each other. Feature 10, Circular stone pile

mods.abstract: [Feature 9] These stones are on a fairly straight line and seemingly mark the limits of a structure but no molds can be traced nor any ditch. Upon complete removal of all the earth over structure 2 and the tracing of the south end of these three lines of stone, it was found that the South end was not completed with a line of rock as on the other three sides. Instead, on the south side approximately 9" above structure 2 were four stones on a line and a row of post molds which did not touch the floor of Structure 2. (See photos 300 & 301). Other stones were found on this level but scattered. In combination with the 8 post molds found on the clay bank 15" above structure 2 and 18" west of stake 8.5 it seems to clearly indicate the super-position of a structure on structure 2 which definitely came at a later period. On the assumption that these lines of stone and post molds marked the limits of a structure, the approximate dimension would be: North side 29' 6"; South side 32'; East side 24'; West side 24'. [Feature 10] A circular pile of stones about 30 in number. The material is sandstone being smooth and rounded. None of the stones have a diameter greater than three inches.
mods.note: For Feature 9, see also photograph 5-79 [fhm00525]. For Feature 10, see also photograph 5-101 [fhm00528].
